episodes.title: Leaving My Cult Family!
episodes.description:
What happens when the love you receive as a child comes with conditions? When the world you're born into demands absolute obedience, and questioning means losing everything?

In this raw and powerful conversation, Sean Faingold takes us inside his journey from being born into the Jehovah's Witnesses—a world where conditional love shaped his earliest understanding of himself—to becoming a fierce advocate for emotional awareness and challenging toxic masculinity.

Sean doesn't just share his story of escape; he reveals the deeper battle that followed. The addiction that filled the void. The struggle to find his voice after years of silence. The moment he realised that true strength isn't about suppressing emotions—it's about having the courage to feel them.

This is a conversation about resilience, healing, and the ongoing journey of self-discovery. Sean's work challenging misogyny and creating safe spaces for men to express their emotions is transforming lives, one vulnerable conversation at a time.

If you've ever felt trapped by expectations, struggled with conditional love, or wondered what it truly means to be emotionally aware in a world that tells men to "toughen up"—this episode will resonate deeply.

Sean's story reminds us that breaking free isn't just about leaving a place—it's about finding the courage to become who you were always meant to be.

This is Part 1 of a 2-part series.

Part One: https://youtu.be/mCC0e22kHfo
Tuesday Truths: https://youtu.be/sGXs4ndWHQ4
Part Two: https://youtu.be/5rqeou37QBA

Connect with Sean Faingold
⁠https://www.instagram.com/seanfaingold?igsh=Znhyd2xtOWw5bnp3⁠

Takeaways 
- Conditional love shapes identity - Growing up with love tied to obedience creates deep wounds that require intentional healing and self-discovery.
- Addiction often fills the void - When we escape one form of control, we can easily fall into another; recognising this pattern is the first step to freedom.
- Emotional suppression isn't strength - True courage lies in feeling and expressing emotions, not burying them beneath a mask of toughness.
- Finding your voice takes time - After years of silence and compliance, learning to speak your truth is a gradual, ongoing process.
- Safe spaces transform lives - Creating environments where men can be vulnerable without judgment is essential for breaking cycles of toxic masculinity.
- Healing is a journey, not a destination - Self-discovery and emotional awareness require continuous work, reflection, and compassion for yourself.
